description:
This place is good.

Nothing fancy; it feels like a real taqueria from a non-fancy place populated by real af people needing real af food.

The CARNITAS are proper crispy fatty tasty, the spicy chicken is tasty, and the rice and beans are what is up.

Reasonable price, got regular burrito and coke for 10.20.

I like places like this because it makes me feel at home, nothing pretentious at all, and it's harder and harder to find these days in SF.

Gracias Chino's
author: Auza A.

description: I really like this place - perfect for when you're craving Mexican takeout. It is cash only, though, which is a little inconvenient. But the burritos are delicious and the staff is friendly. I'd recommend it for sure!
author: Moira D.

description: How the heck did this place get 4 stars..... must be all the hipsters and transplants rating this place that doesn't know anything about a real mission style burrito... all I can say is no bueno!!!!! Don't waste your money!!!!
author: Manolo V.

description: I had nachos here with the spicy chicken, and it's really good. Portion is good. Flavor is there, but it's not overly salty like the food at other Mexican taquerias. I would say that the guacamole is a bit watered down and they are skimpy with it. I would come here again if I am craving Mexican food and is in the area.
author: Erica M.

description:
Don't believe the hype. Ambiance wise it has a cool hole in the wall vibe but that's where the flavor stops. 

I wanted to like this place but it was just really not all that great.  I'm genuinely confused because California has never disappointed my tastes buds when it comes to Mexican food. I have had much better, flavorful tacos from an East Coast taco truck in DC and yes, don't hate, Chipotle. 

I came with my family of 6 and the meal came to about 60 plus...so expensive to boot considering this place is a borderline health code violation. (Hello uncovered horchata jar, looking of questionable freshness on the counter. It had a line of residue where it looked like it had simply been refilled.)

The food is really is bland which is a shame because the cuts of steak in my steak taco were great. But sadly their seasoning just did not fulfill their potential.
author: Niky P.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for thirty-odd years. Twenty years ago, Chino's was great. Today? They're just phoning it in. It's not that they've gotten worse. It's that they've gotten complacent while everyone else got better.

And cash only? Please... you only need a smartphone these days to take card payments. "Cash only" suggests "cash laundering."
author: Robert H.

description: The food is mediocre. I have lived in California my whole life including San Diego and San Francisco and comparatively the food is subpar. Burrito I got was flavorless and expensive for what you get. Tortilla was nothing special and wasn't even grilled as is the style at many California taquerias and a hallmark of a burrito place that puts in the extra time to crisp it up. There are better places to get exceptional Mexican food in the city so I would look elsewhere if I were you.
author: Michael G.

description:
Places where I didn't eat one of the blandest burritos of my life:
1. A 24-hour university restaurant in Washington, D.C.
2. A tourist spot in Berlin

I'm devastated that this burrito joint in San Francisco, of all places, was actually the culprit. This hole-in-the-wall often has a line out the door during the lunch rush, which led me to believe that Chino's must be pretty good if it had gotten the neighborhood's stamp of approval. Service was speedy and friendly, but my chicken burrito was utterly flavorless, even though I tried to salvage it with hot sauce. 

It was a lost cause. Maybe I should've gotten the spicy chicken burrito or maybe I should've just gone to Gordo's instead.
author: Amy C.

description:
I wasn't planning to travel to the Outer Richmond to have a taco, but Jamie W. and I were enjoying a leisurely Saturday afternoon and by process of elimination, mostly a series of Jamie's small-mouth reactions to anything I suggested, we landed on this modest operation on Balboa Street. It's not that this neighborhood is all that hoity-toity or that riff-raff like us didn't belong there. No, we just didn't expect to see a taqueria among the coffee cafes and more traditional, north-of-the-border food to be found in this enclave. The menu was pretty standard - tacos, burritos, nachos and meat plates.

Jamie went for the $7.10 Super Vegetarian Burrito with plenty of black beans, rice, salsa and lettuce wrapped in a soft spinach flour tortilla (photo: http://bit.ly/2mTimni). It was heartier than most, though it needed a major dousing of hot sauce to enliven it. I ordered the $3.99 Super Carnitas Taco which had a lot more rice than pork on a soft flour tortilla with a drippy tomatillo sauce ladled on top of a tuft of sour cream, salsa, and black beans (photo: http://bit.ly/2mFY7IX). The shredded pork was also a bit too wet to truly savor but it was otherwise reasonable for a late afternoon bite. The pace was leisurely to match the food.

FOOD - 3 stars...reasonably decent Mexican lacks kick but satisfies with the basics
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...clean and sparse and not much else
SERVICE - 3 stars...guys dish out the food pretty much on automatic pilot
TOTAL - 3 stars...nothing offensive here, nothing extraordinary either...a foggy day in taco town
author: Ed U.

description:
This place makes Chipotle seem like a haven for patrons seeking flavorful tortilla wrapped foods. For a restaurant that is doing the whole "hole in the wall" thing so well, (San Quentin prison bars over their oh so valuable windows and paint that may be derived from gold, colorful but poorly painted murals of things, random personal belongings littered across the eating area, furniture that was cheap even in the 80's, and cash only), I was utterly surprised when I took that first bite. 

I've had steam jasmine white rice that had more flavor than the Spanish rice they put in my burrito. That's a bad first impression. It didn't get any better. The carne asada tasted like it was made days before. The salsas were bland and provided a mild amount of salt that helped the nursing home burritos. All of this can be yours for $9.70. Way over Yelp's misleading price of $5.50.

Alas, not everything was bad. The burrito was at least filling. But isn't that what food is supposed to do at the bare minimum? The beans and tortillas were ok, but both can be purchased in the store with minor prep. 

Here's my takeaway: follow your instincts when you go to a Mexican hole in the wall. If the meats are already sitting in food warmers, turn around and get yourself out of the door.
author: Alan H.

description: Chino's rocks. Just know that it is cash-only! My parents go across the park for their regular Saturday-evening burritos, and I've stopped in a few times on my way home. The super burrito is reasonably priced and full of good stuff. Plus, you get to watch it made right in front of you. Their staff is courteous, and the last time I went, I was a dollar short on the bill for two burritos--they remembered my parents and told me to bring it in the next time. Thank you!
author: Matt C.

description:
Unassuming but satisfying enough to do the trick. Chino's is a modest and straightforward taqueria to grab a quick bite in the Outer Richmond or GG park.

It feels like a neighborhood spot that has been part of the community for a while. Looks like lots of local regulars in here. The burritos are a decent size and they are pretty generous with the protein. I got the carnitas and thought they were well-seasoned. Could have been a little crispier but no bigger. I think the overall flavors of the burrito get pretty one-note quickly and could really use some/more fresh salsa to brighten it up. Still if you're hungry, it will be more than enough to fill you up. 

Stop by Chino's Taqueria for a quick and efficient meal once you've worked up an appetite post-walk through Golden Gate Park.
author: Jon L.

description:
I just came here to buy dinner for me and my husband. OMG, this place is awful.... unless you like food with no flavor. 

I ordered a mild super burrito for my husband. The guy who was making the burrito asked if he could just put a little bit of hot sauce in it anyway (I wondered why) I said sure. 

Anyway, when we get home, my husband opens up the burrito. Their super burritos are weird. I didn't see any guacamole or pico de Gallo. Maybe he wasn't paying attention and just put very little. I wondered if the guy probably put hot sauce in it because the burrito would be super bland.I mean, What are you paying the extra $1 for? Sour cream and cheese. Ew. 

I got a regular taco. Super flavorless as was the burrito yet surprisingly mine was worse. Also, no free chips 

I came here for convenience. I wish I went to nick's tacos @ underdogs or Gordo's instead
author: Nancy M.

description: Giant tacos!  Usually I will get 2 but here with all the fixings... really just needed one.
author: Colleen E.

description:
Pretty good carnitas at Chino's. I've tried the other meats and they are decent, but nothing special -- carnitas is king here and what I recommend. Wish they would expand their menu to include al pastor or chorizo. Friendly staff. Generous portions. 

However: buyer beware. The prices here are inconsistent with what the menus say. The Yelp menu says $5.50 but I paid about $9.50 for a regular meat burrito (no cheese) with sour cream (an extra item). The prices on the wall menu in the taqueria don't reflect what you actually pay. It's totally confusing. Chino's should update the prices on their menu which are completely different from what they actually charge.
author: Ralphie K.

description: Awesome local spot. Family owned and friendly folks. They are not shy with portions at all so come hungry, you're guaranteed to leave happy! Grab some food and walk down to the beach :) perfect for any time of day.
author: Parasto S.

description: Not impressed. I was looking forward to some authentic flavor. Although I don't like spicy food, I do like flavor. I might have been happier with a different meal, but I don't think I'll be back. And I'm afraid to look up their health score. (But they had a steady stream of what looked like regulars so maybe you just have to like spicy food to enjoy your meal here.)
author: M S.

description: I was here yesterday, Memorial Day. The place is 2 blocks from Golden Gate Park Polo Field. We had about 30 people from our soccer team. No problem, accommodated us all, Food was good and everyone finished. My large Nacho and drink was about $14.
author: Winglo A.

description: Get the super taco, as much food as a burrito with the yummy corn tortillas, they'll put cheese, rice, and beans on it.
author: Hayden M.

description: I use to live not far from this place and would walk there for dinner all the time! I love their spicy chicken in burritos! Friendly staff, delicious food, nice hole in the wall neighborhood place.
author: Catherine W.

description: I love this place! It's not the most amazing burrito I've ever had in my life (SoCal burritos are just in another league anyway) but it's delicious and filling! Their spicy chicken or Chile verde carnitas are my faves. The people that own/run it are super friendly too. I love the vibe and it helps that it's super close to home and work. Cash only tho so be prepared!
author: Meghan H.

description:
Certainly not a fancy place. It's ok. Just ok. Very nice staff.  The guacamole tasted like the packs that come frozen from Costco. Being a guacamole loving family, we were not impressed.  They do have three different types of flour tortillas ( white flour, spinach and red which I think is tomato?)

It's nothing to seek out but if you are in the area and beef something to eat, check it out. They have the basics.
author: Nettie A.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants I have found in the San Francisco area. You should not go for the ambience as it is a typical Mexican restaurant that puts their focus on the food, not the setting. I ordered the super taco with beef and was really pleased with the flavors and portion size.
author: Jim H.

description:
Chino's is da Bomb.  And I lived in the Mission around the corner from Taqueria Cancun for a good part of the 1990s.  So there.  I have a reference for what makes a good burrito.
I get the Red Chicken Super Burrito with salsa picante and extra jalapenos.
The Boy gets vegetarian no lettuce no sour cream and 4 jalapenos plus a horchata or a jalisco tamarindo.
author: Robyn C.

description:
Consistently disappointing. I'm not sure how this restaurant, which is constantly staffed by authentic-seeming people of Hispanic descent, manages to be SO bland. It honestly is just like if my white-as-wonder-bread mother tried to make a big burrito, AND her spice cabinet had just been destroyed in a tragic fire.

I even gave this place three tries, assuming I must have made a mistake...and I did make a mistake, but that mistake was going back...
author: Chris S.

description: Best burritos in town! Delicious and fresh. Chips are only 80¢. This place is cash only! Hidden gem
author: Olivia R.

description: The vegetarian burritos are pretty good, with two different kinds of beans to choose from. Their quesadillas are chocked full of toppings. It's a little difficult to tell the quesadilla from the burrito, except for the fried-ness of the tortilla.
author: Ed M.

description: The spicy chicken super burrito is the only way to go. Packed with flavor and juicy. Been going here since the late 90's. Way better then GORDO's
author: Tim C.

description:
Adding to Gordo vs Chino comps...

Having been going to Gordo for decades, gave Chino a try.  I can see why many like like Chino more as fish tacos are offered vs none at Gordo.

Hot sauce is punchier and will rob you of your taste bud.  Not too fond of that as I want to taste my food not bleed hot sauce.  To each their own.

Chino cost about 30% more... Super burrito is $9 vs Gordo at $6.5

Mine wasn't packed like Gordo, lots of room
For more food.  Taste is very comparable for both.  But I asked Chino... Do you use lard.  Nope

As Gordo the answer is Si Senior 
Pork fat ruled at Gordo
author: David H.

description: YUM. Love this place. Burritos are on point - love the carnitas, but there are lots of meat options (and some veggie as well). Nachos are always enormous and equally delicious. Friendly and efficient staff makes the line go quickly and the food is worth the wait. Great local spot! (Cash only!)
author: Madeline M.

description: Have been going to Chinos now for over 15+ years! Authentic Mexican family food, best of the best and will always stay loyal to the best in San Francisco!
author: Daniel S.

description:
They don't expect you to love their food, they just want you to respect their food.

I have come here quite a bit, and it's not the best Mexican food, but it has very consistently satisfied my late night hungers.

The people there are nice, and I like how they have white, green, and pink wraps to choose from. I would say that their portion sizes a just bit smaller than desired, but I cannot complain too much considering the affordable prices.
author: Kevin T.

description: It doesn't look like that much from outside but it's what's inside that counts. Check that -- actually it doesn't look like much from inside either but these people know how to make one delicious "mission-style" burrito.
author: Ed L.

description:
Best burritos and tacos in the Richmond by far.  Live life on the edge and dive in for a super burrito on a spinach or tomato tortilla.

If you're feeling EXTRA risky, ask em for a jumbo...and if you don't finish it, don't be ashamed.  You wouldn't be the first to succumb.
author: Silvia Z.

description:
I live in the Outer Mission, and have access to
good and bad Mexican Food!

I find Chinos to be Excellent! I have been going there
once a week for about 3 or more years, and have tried
all the Burritos.

Don't know what all the Bad Reviews are about, since when I have
been there, it is sometimes crowded with the Students from George
Washington High School...

But mostly I see a lot of Working Hispanics stopping for their food,
so if they can eat it, don't know why Gringos can't!
author: Jerry W.

description:
This is a good taqueria that is hidden away in the outer Richmond and has been around for decades.  Chino's hits a nostalgia spot for me, since I used to frequent this spot with friends after high school in the early 00's.
Parking in this area is pretty easy, since there are a lot of metered spots along Balboa.  The taqueria hasn't changed it's decor after all this time (which is fine to me), with painting on the wall, a large dining area and a traditional taqueria line when you walk through the door.  The staff here are very friendly and efficient.  They offer your usual taqueria fare, including burritos, tacos, nachos, quesadillas and a plate option.  I think that the carnitas is very good, along with the chili verde, but the best to me is the spicy chicken.
I don't understand some of the one star reviews for this spot, because it certainly has better taste than Gordo's and while it may not be on the same level as La Taqueria, it is still a great spot that I go to regularly.  Too bad reviewers can't have ratings along with the establishments they criticize.  Check it out if you are in the area and craving no frills Mexican food.
author: Brian C.

description:
With so few options in the outer Richmond, you may often throw up your hands and say fine, I'm desperate enough to go to gordo's, that place where good burrito flavors go to die. 

Well fear not fellow Richmond residents, there's another (slightly less disappointing) taqueria in our hood. El Chino has been around for a long time, but now it's getting a little hip factor with the addition of a new parklet - ahh al fresco dining!
Now? Back to the burritos. I ordered the super chicken and asked for picante sauce. Despite the picante, and all the other toppings, it managed to taste somehow bland. Perhaps the chicken needs more spices. Huge burrito though - I should have cut that foil clad beast into two, and saved half for later but....once you pop, you can't stop!

My date had the super carnitas burrito. I took a bite of his and it was pretty tasty. Definitely more seasoned than the pollo.

The horchata was a nice sweet treat to wash it all down.

Would only come back here if I didn't feel like going all the way to the mission. 

Unless....

I have a feeling the burrito could be better if I ask them if they have a special top secret sauce stash that they are willing to share... I'll try to charm it out of them next time!
author: Carole B.

description:
I have an update as of 07/08/17 
 So, As much as I never wanted to go here again, My car was in the shop and I was craving a Burrito so against better judgment my roommate and I decided to trek down to Chino's. The guy ahead of me got a Chicken burrito on a plain tortilla, no cheese or extras of any kind. The price on the wall: $5.90 for a regular Burrito. I am behind this guy and get the same thing. The guy gets charged $6.20 total. My Burrito is finished, the guy at the register says: $7.90. I say " what ?" The guy ahead of me got charged $6.20. Why are you charging me $7.90 ? he tells me" I charged him the same price " I said: no you didn't . He mumbles something to the guy making the Burritos and he looks at me, then looks at the guy at the register and the guy says $7.90. I gave the guy $6.30 and walked out the door. These guys have to be skimming money from people. My roommate said he never gets charged the same price. maybe off by .50 or by a Dollar. But you figure doing this all day they rack up a decent amount at the end of the day. Their boss never knows and most people probably never notice. Screw this place and those shifty jerks that work there. I hope their boss sees this and installs cameras.
author: Jerry A.

description:
One of the best burrito spots in SF.
Their carnitas is the BEST. Affordable, quant, casual spot. Never a long line, lots of space to sit and enjoy. Or take your burrito to the beach!
Red salsa is spicy and yummy.
The guys who work here are all awesome.
They melt the cheese on the burrito before making for an extra good burrito!
author: Jean Marie C.

description: Very good mexican food in the outer Richmond district, the prices are inexpensive. I get the chicken burrito and the price is cheaper than Gordos.  I remember coming here when I did off campus lunch when I went to Washington High. I have been here a few times when I have been to the movies at the Balboa. I remember they only do cash not card.
author: Alix J.

description: So so good.  The 1st time I've had the type of Mexican food I'm used to since being in SF.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Their burritos are not by any measure the best in the city, and the menu is pretty straightforward. Nothing extremely exciting. Satisfying if you're very hungry and want some straight forward Mexican fast food. But if you get a super taco, you may find yourself pleasantly surprised and returning again and again. CASH ONLY!

To the guy (Chris S) who wrote a review that the quality of the food didn't match how "authentic" the ethnicity of the dudes behind the counter is - that sentiment is pretty damn racist, whether intended or not. Not a very witty review, buddy.
author: P N.

description: There is not enough salt in any of it. But I gotta respect the fact it's had a permanent line since, like, 1995.
author: Francesca S.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this restaurant.  I love all the choices tomato, spinach, corn tortillas, spicy chicken, grilled chicken, carnival, red sauce, green sauce and all GOOD! PRICE IS RIGHT. I come all the way from Antioch!
author: Phyllis G.

description:
Just a short walk from the family home. The food here is great fast cheap and friendly.

Being from Australia really any burrito here is better than we get back in AU and les than half the price.

Can be a little fast paced at dinner time with a line out the door and you need to think fast to order.
author: Mark H.

description: This is my new favorite burrito place! The staff is incredibly helpful and welcoming and give great recommendations. Needless to say the burritos are out of this world. I got the beef burrito and it literally melted in my mouth. Could not say enough good things about this place, can't wait for next time!
author: Tess O.

description:
SO. GOOD. Really, my favorite burrito place in the city. I highly recommend Chino's!

And the people that run it are the nicest!! Cash only, so be aware of that. They have a variety of tortillas (my favorite is the spinach one), and don't charge an arm and a leg.
author: Katie P.

description: Right now I'm on a limited diet from my doctor. I ordered bean and rice burrito. Very simple order with some guacamole. It was good but i bet with more ingredients the burritos are better. They gave napkins and a bag for my togo order which was nice.
author: Benjamin G.

description: Hot damn what a burrito, unlike that ponchos place on Geary. I swear to this place like a cow swears to grass.
author: Russell C.

description:
Some of the worst so-called Mexican food I've ever had.

Friendly service but crappy food. Tastes like something prepared for public school students. They actually make Taco Bell look good in comparison.
author: Di P.

description:
These guys are great! 
Good flavors and nice veggie burritos 
I could be interested in some new veggie options though. Peppers? Squash? 
All in all they are always working hard and move the line fast and serve quality food.
author: nick l.

description:
This is the only decent burrito next my house and it's  30 blocks away. This is your typical neighborhood Taqueria and everything here is just fine. It is a bit of a dive but that's really kind of what I want from a Taqueria.

I highly recommend the Carne Asada burrito with guacamole sour cream and cheese.

Don't forget to get a horchata.
author: Justin S.

description: Local Mexican burrito joint. It's not the best burrito I have had but it's very consistent and tastes good. Chinos makes a steamed burrito.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I love this place! Delicious tacos, well that's what I always get, but everything is great. I love he carnitas, so tasty, and not too fatty.
The people are friendly and service is fast. Definitely a hole in the wall type of place but worth the detour. One of my favorites in town.
author: rebecca p.

description:
This place is small and kinda hidden away.  But it's been here for many many years.  They are not usually busy but there is a steady stream of customers.  

The food is on par with the other burrito joints in the Mission.  But now, with me being in the west end of the City i'm quite lucky to have Chinos just up the block from my motorcycle shop.  

I used to come here back in the '90s when I lived off of Balboa.  I'm glad it's still around.  I recommend this spot for an awesome picnic lunch at the beach or park.  Just order to go and enjoy!
author: Miguel C.

description: Been living in the Outer Richmond for going on 5 years now and this spot is seriously one of the most underrated taquerias in the city. Healthy portions and the guys are super friendly. Recommended for hangovers or Hockey Haven drinking.
author: Chris R.

description:
Literally the worst stale tasteless burrito ever.
The food tasted like it was stale and no one was present on a busy Sunday afternoon. I was skeptical but I wanted to try it out none the less as it's the only Mexican place in the neighborhood.
The salsa was bubbling like it was fermenting and yes it tasted bad. I am really sorry to have picked this spot.
I just wanted to leave the food and run before I get sick. I left the food half way and ran.
Never will I come here or suggest anyone to come here again.
author: Maya A.

description: This place hit the spot on multiple different levels, very friendly and nice owners/staff, well priced, good quality of food, great environment with a classic Mexican Taqueria interior, close to Point Lobos so there is something great and outdoors to do before and/or after you eat here.
author: Bryce W.

description:
¡Cómo me encanta Chino's Taquería!  

I ordered a quesadilla with carnitas on a corn tortilla. It was prepared on the grill just long enough to give the quesadilla a little crispness while not drying out the tortilla. 

The flavors are great, the service is efficient, and the staff is courteous.
author: Rob T.

description:
I've been going here for over a decade! SOOO AMAZING!
No joke, these guys rock! Francisco is super bad ass! They all are!

Spinach tortilla
Boiled Chicken
Refried Beans
Guac
Rice
Half and Half sauce
Lettuce when you feel a little healthy

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Chinos and Ocean Beach!
author: Victoria V.

description: So I'm back to living in the outer Richmond .. And thank god I'm back to living close to chinos .. Still get my same old quesadilla with refried beans and it's still perfect.. These guys are the best. Great prices too. Love supporting them!
author: Alyssa H.

description: Went in on a Sunday afternoon and the restaurant was quiet.  Small menu, mostly tacos and burritos.  We ordered 5 tacos and a drink and it came to $18.  Since they are not making plates, the food is ready to be prepared so service is fast.
author: Cathy R.

description:
They have a nice selection of meat and other burrito fillings.  I like that they have both red (spicy) and green (mild sauce).  We got in-and-out quickly.

That said, the food was overpriced (OK, "overpriced" is relative since we paid $13 for two burritos) and was a little bit underwhelming for dive Mexican.  If you are in walking distance, go check it out but I would not go out of my way to visit.
author: Gary A.

description: I've been coming to Chinos for over 15 years. It is by far my favorite taqueria, so consistent and delicious. My go-to order is a quesadilla with rice, black beans, spicy chicken AND carnitas, and all the toppings with red hot sauce. YUM FREAKIN' YUM!!!!
author: Samantha F.

description: Awesome food! Burritos and Nachos FTW
author: Himesh P.

description:
My favorite here is the jumbo burrito with spinach tortilla. Half spicy chicken and half grilled chicken. Salsa lettuce sour cream guacamole jalepneos a pinch of hot sauce cheese and extra sour cream. With a side of chips and salsa. 

Also to wash it down with a mexican soda the tamarind flavor
author: Andy L.

description:
Both my wife and I thought that Chinos was just alright. We ordered a spicy chicken burrito, as well as an order of nachos. 

Service up front was great, the two guys that were working the day that we came in were super friendly, and very helpful. Unfortunately once we got our food and started eating it was just somewhat bland and uninspired. The spicy chicken wasn't spicy, the salsa wasn't spicy or super flavorful, and the beans and rice were the same. They also had a nice big tub of Horchata, so of course I ended up getting a glass to go. 

Overall a moderately disappointing experience, that just had me wishing we went into the Mission instead.
author: Chris S.

description:
I got the nachos.  Cheese was weak. Guac was good but there wasnt enough. Not enough sour cream. Carne asada was dry and flavorless. Rice and lettuce made it different. it wasnt greasy for some reason.  Overall it was meah...  Ill eat it, but I dont feel happy or grossed out (in a good way).  What tip the scales from acceptable to unacceptable was the chips. The chips were super thin. It couldnt even hold the cheese. 

Would I come back, no I wouldnt. $9 for nachos? I rather get taco bell nachos than here for nachos.  the only redeeming feature was that it looked colorful. see my photo.
author: Jason C.

description: May be good burritos, but very dishonest practice. My son (12 yo) went in himself to buy one burrito and he was charged $ 17.65 for it. I had to go back to ask for an explanation for the excessive amount for one burrito. The cashier told me that my son requested extra meat and each extra meat costs extra $2.5. The menu does not list $2.5 for extra meat and the guy did not say anything to my son when he was ordering  except for asking him whether he wanted other types of meat in the burrito. Not knowing that it would cost him extra, my son added 2 more types of meat in the burrito. Well, how much extra meat can someone stuff in a burrito? Not that more. A super burrito costs $7.10.  With 2 extra meats, it should have cost $12.10. How in the world could the cashier charged my son $17.65? $5.5 for tax?? Was it a mistake? I don't think so. The guy was dishonested when he did not mention about the extra charge for the meat. The cashier charged my son the  incorrect amount. After some argument with the cashier, she agreed to refund the extra meat charges. Will not go back. They tried to rip off my son. So sad.
author: Roberto C.

description:
Great prices and friendly happy service.

Clean and fresh.

Offers tomato and spinach wraps.

Fresh horchata.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I love this place! Great burritos and tacos for the Outer Richmond.  I like that they use asadero cheese. The green salsa is amazing.  The spicy chicken is really good too.  

The only complaint is that they are cash only.  I always end up having to hit the ATM before I can satisfy my burrito cravings.
author: Carley Z.

description:
Came here for lunch. 

Service: Very fast, nice, friendly

Food: A-OK, nothing to really write home about, I got a huge burrito, spicy chicken was nice, but there was nothing really in it other than rice. They need more pico, more flavor, more spice.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
I haven't been here in years, but fortunately, it was even better than I remember. I used to come here with my aunt whenever I visited her in the city and even though it had been a few years, the employees still remembered us. It's so refreshing to see that all of them were just as genuine and kind as I remembered. 

I ordered my staple: the veggie burrito. I've eaten a lot of veggie burritos, but this just might be the best. The rice was so moist & flavorful, the refried beans had the perfect consistency with the right amount of salt, the pico de gallo was super fresh, the guacamole was awesome...everything came together so perfectly! Plus, they steam the tortilla with the cheese prior to adding everything and steam the finished burrito after, resulting in the cheese being ooey & gooey and just right! They will even grill the burrito for you if you ask. 

AND the price is right! ~$5 for a filling burrito plus service with a smile, which is always priceless! :)
author: Megan M.

description: Chino's is an awesome local grab and go Mexican spot. You can eat there too- but as we're local to the area it's one of our favorite lazy night places. Their quesadillas are delicious and for the approx $8 with guac that they cost, can't be beat. Just note- it's cash only so come prepared!
author: Kimberly K.

description: Delicious. Carne asada super burrito with spinach tortilla left me full and satisfied. Cute atmosphere and friendly service. Also I like how they make the burritos right in front you. Nice local feel.
author: Stefanie G.

description: I really wanted to keep going there but I got sick on one of their burritos. I know it was the burrito because it was the only thing I ate yesterday.
author: Jeff W.

description: I had the chicken burrito and its pretty darn good. Their marinate was seasoned just right. I've enjoyed gordo and el burrito for countless years but this was a pleasant surprise.  Don't let the lack of updated decor deter you.
author: Keith W.

description: I've been coming here for over 20 years and the food has not changed even minutely in quality in that entire time. There's a lot to be said for consistency in a burrito. This is the place I come to to get that carnitas burrito just the way I need it. Family from out of town always breaks their post airport fast here. It's a neighborhood staple. Go ahead, pack one in your purse and go catch a movie at the Balboa. Or go eat it at the bar at Hockey Haven. These guys are half the reason I passed college Spanish. "Como se dice 'global warming' en espanol?"
author: Zachariah L.

description: Best burrito in town! Love Chino's, have been going there for over 20 yrs.  In 2006 I moved to the other side of SF (close to Nob Hill) and still drive to Chino's to get a burrito!
author: Denise D.

description:
Best taqueria in town! 

I go for the super quesadilla with rice, carnitas, lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa verde. Their spicy chicken, chile verde, and grilled shrimp are also excellent. 

It's often crowded but is well worth the wait. The line moves really quickly, and the guys that work there are wonderful.
author: Molly P.

description: Great vegetarian burrito. No beer offered but fast and friendly service.
author: John H.

description:
FOOD
1.) Chicken super burrito - yum actually really good I would come here for my Mexican choice in sf, luckily it's convenient for me. Love it with the GREEN skin. 
2.) Super Quesedilla = So their difference between quesidilla and burrito is between if you want the skin pan fried and slightly crispy. Otherwise the insdies are like a fully loaded burrito. 

SERVICE
Friendly workers. Cash only boo. 


ATMOSPHERE
Kinda random and a little dirty not really great. But oh well it's for the food and convenience.

12.16.13
author: Angela L.

description: I just moved to the neighborhood and this place is so solid!!  Great food great prices... cash only.. everything is super fresh Sony the end of the day options might be reduced because they run out. For it just means I get to try a different item and I get blown away how it is!
author: Mischa H.

description: This place is awesome. Get the super burrito or super taco. Extremely authentic taqueria in a very cool part of the city.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Best burritos in the Richmond! Chili verde and carnitas are on point here. Super burrito comes in spinach wrap, tomato, whole wheat or regular. Amazing black beans too. You can tell this place puts care into their recipes and ingredients
author: Ian S.

description: This is a small, mostly empty, but very tasty taqueria. I order the tacos here & am not disappointed. Their meat options are all delicious so you can't go wrong. They make the food quickly, they are priced well and you can always get a seat. Just don't forget your cash, because this spot is cash only!
author: Heather S.

description:
I stopped by here after passing by so many times, it's always empty in there so I kind of get an iffy feeling about eating at this place. 

However, I decided to this time and I was right about my hunch.. First off let me say, the food wasn't horribly bad. I ordered a super burrito. It wasn't bad at all, although the chicken was somewhat dry and had a burnt chewy texture. I'm not really a hard one to satisfy though so that was ok with me. Pic de gallo tasted just fine, the spinach tortilla was warm, the rice had a little flavor, and the guac wasn't too bad either. 

I walked out pretty confident that this would be a good replacement for Gordo's as it's closer and more convenient to me. 

Fast forward 8 hours later, I wake up 3am in pain with stomach cramps saying to myself "if this is what women go through when they have cramps, I have much respect for you". Waves and waves of pain until just recently. 

I wish this wasn't the case but something wasn't right with what I ate. Either the food was old and kept out on the warmer too long or sanitation was off but man did I feel it. 

Service is good though. Everyone's friendly and greet you as you walk in. If it weren't for bad food experience, I would frequent this place but maybe I'll give it another go in the future.
author: Hiroki M.

description:
Favorite Mexican food in San Francisco! First place I ate after moving to S.F in 1995 and used to go 3 times a week. Family owned and they are all friendly.

Gracias,

Guero
author: O G.

description:
DIRTY!!  Dirty floor, tables, bathroom.  There is even a garbage bin (the kind that is on the streets with the rats and such) in the restaurant--disgusting (is that even allowed?)

Meat is soaking in funkiness.  Beans are syrupy.  Avoid.
author: Max L.

description: The best burritos! The neat is good. the service is great, always options to choose from. delicious fast cheap!
author: Rebecca B.

description: Two decades. This is good food. Perfectly sizzled chicken, fresh ingredients. Nothing better.
author: Laurie P.

description: Chinos is our go to taqueria. The guys are great, the food always good, and we can grab and go on those busy evenings when only Chinos can satisfy our tastebuds and hunger in a flash! Thanks!
author: Rob W.

description:
I don't know how this place got so many good reviews. I just left the place and I'll tell you I am so unsatisfied. came here to hopefully find a new good spot to grab a burrito but never again. 1 super burrito and 1 super quesadilla. Didn't grill the meat, it seemed like the food has been in the warmer all day. Steamed the tortilla and started putting all the ingredients. Blobs of salsa and lettuce and rice. Skimpy on the meat. Quesadilla, for some reason the man didn't use the big tortilla like other taquerias would. Instead it was a smaller flour tortilla which thank God he actually grilled a little bit. Then he added on the meat, which was in the warmer. And blobs of salsa and sour cream lettuce and guacamole were added. But he wrapped like a burrito and even asked of I wanted rice and beans in it. Now I've had plenty of
Latino food to know that rice and beans are not in a quesadilla. Mind you this is a
Super quesadilla. I started eating and before I even took a bite I was already bummed out. Unhappy and disappointed. Food was cold. Burrito was cold especially. And the meat had no type of flavor. My quesadilla was leaking tomato juice and that was also cold. They should change their food. Everything cooked to order, fresh grilled hot meat with flavor and spice. Not I'm a warmer. Use the grill you got in their for Pete's sake.
author: Victor S.

description:
Stopped by here today to grab a quick bite on my 4/20 easter adventure and it was actually pretty good!

 My Food: I ordered the spicy chicken super burrito and it was pretty good! There wasn't too much on it toppings wise but I didn't mind it was actually too much volume wise for me! They are a good size and it was pretty fresh, I just wish there was more guac and it was spicier though. Seeing that is was a taqueria I definitely needed more spice!

Experience: There weren't too many people there so I was in and out pretty quickly! I took my food to-go so I wasn't able to sit down and look around but it was clean and there was ample seating!
author: Amy S.

description: One of the best taquerias ever. Love everything they serve. Nachos with grilled chicken is one of my favorites.
author: Chris S.

description:
I love this place!  I appreciate the location, but it is certainly not the main reason why I keep coming back. All of the standard ingredients are solid and tasty. The carnitas & green chile are excellent. The rest of the meats pleasantly surprise whenever I get them, or finish my daughter's food. The guac isn't excellent, but it adds to the good taste whenever I do add it. The green hot sauce is exceptional!  To top it off the guys are all SUPER nice. That cannot be underestimated because I've been to Gordos plenty of times, the food is pretty good, but the dudes are NEVER nice. It definitely affects my decision. 

I've lived in San Diego & LA. Huge burrito eater in both places so I feel like I have a good perspective. I'm sure people have valid reasons for disagreeing with me, but Chinos is a super solid, if not great, taqueria.
author: Jack D.

description: Best burritos in the Richmond. Don't forget the jalapeños. It helps to look at the ingredients and see what looks freshest.
author: John J.

description: Great burritos if you are in a hurry and need a quick lunch or dinner. Lots of seating if you want to dine in.
author: Virginia C.

description:
Chino's is setup like faro's with a steam table full of prepped foods ready to be scooped.. i went in with 8 minutes on the meter and come out with 4 minutes to spare..

eats: chile verde burrito(4.90)
-red onions, choice of beans, lean pork, got medium salsa, shouldd got hot. rice, and the usual ....
-tasted ok. 

frijoles refritos:
-didn't check to see if salsa bar available
-lots of seating available
-a possible repeat. cheap eats.
author: Victor G.

description: Great burritos at great prices. My go to spot since its pretty close to where I live.
author: Jamie ..

description: This place is close to where I live and decently priced.  But my friend feels like their burritos are getting smaller.  He even said he's gonna have to start getting 2 burritos to fill him up!  LOL!  This place isn't the best looking taqueria, but I like their super tacos.  One carne asada and one spicy chicken and I'm good to go!
author: Elena N.

description: Decent for outside the mission the carnita tacos some times don't have flavor also prices have gone up
author: Remysbarbie M.

description: Always ask for the receipt and make sure you're charged correctly for your order.  One time, I placed an order for two burritos.  It came up to a certain amount and I just gave them the cash.  They have me change back and moved on to the next customer. When I was adding the two burritos in my head, the total didn't add up.  So I asked the cashier to give me a receipt.  After he printed out, I asked what this $2.00 charge was for.  Apparently, he made a mistake of charging $2.00 instead of $0.20 for sour cream.  This happened twice on different occasions.  So check your receipts.
author: Jack L.

description:
I've never done a review on yelp and never planned too, the deciding factor was this restaurant. I live in the neighborhood and have been eating here regularly for 5 months now with zero disappointments. The service is great and you'll typically be greeted with a smile. The cook line is always kept extremely clean, which is a big plus for some. 

Okay, onto the food. The burritos are great and consistently great. The quesadilla is basically a grilled burrito so don't expect the typical quesadilla, it was good though. I've never ventured outside of those items on the menu. I have a hard time reviewing a mexican restaurant because a lot of people's taste varies on the subject. Some will say the food here is average but then others will say it's one of the best burritos they've had. I fall into the latter category. 

Long story short, if you're in the outer richmond and have burritos on the brain, head to Chinos.

PS Cash only
author: Curtis P.

description: I love Mexican food, but after visiting Chino's Taqueria I wasn't that impressed. The waiter service sucks! I ordered their chicken buritto, it was too runny, and the chicken tasted like it was from a can. We sat down to eat, and the benches they have are not clean. They also didn't take credit cards the last time I was here. Asked for extra hot sauce inside the burrito, this was the best part of the burrito otherwise it would have been plain. This restaurant it is okay. I wish it was better so I wouldn't have to go so far to get a burrito for lunch. Also, the parking is limited. As much as I might want Mexican food, I won't be coming here!
author: Alain L.

description:
I went to Chino's for years when I lived in the neighborhood and loved their awesome burritos. If Chino was there he made the best burritos but the other guy made decent ones too. So I happened to be in the hood and had a craving for one. Well completely different guys there and the guy who made my burrito made the lamest burrito I have ever had. He barely put any cheese, lettuce, tomatoes or guacamole on it. Basically it was rice, carnitas, beans and 2 dollops of sour cream. The Carnitas was totally bland. Oh and did I mention that one of the guys was plunging the sink?

Chino's was once great.... I'll live with those memories and never go back.
author: Steven B.

description:
3 and a 1/2  stars. 

I thought this place would totally suck due to the crappy reviews and creepy unclean looking interior.  However, I was pleasantly surprised.  The spiced chicken taco for just under $4 was substantial.  The chicken was tender and had the perfect amount of spice.  The extra hot sauce also made it memroable.  Tortilla stood up to all the loaded fixings.  Made 2 tacos out of the 2 tortillas.  Would not make my way all the way out there, but if you are in the area I think it is better than Gordo's.
author: Chelsey G.

description: a bit obsessed with this place... it might be a problem.  It's our local go-to for mexican food... super quick and easy.  My favorite is the spicy chicken burrito and my husband loves the steak and the carnitas.  Honestly, though, we have never had something we haven't enjoyed.  The nachos and the quesadillas are both delish! They are a CASH ONLY spot...
author: Kelly M.

description:
I don't even need to look at the menu when I go to Chino's, because I've been coming here since '98!  My usual is a Burrito with Cheese, Rice, Refried Beans,  Plain Chicken, Sour Cream, Guacamole, and Mild Green Sauce.

Honorable mention is their nachos/tortilla chips and carnitas! Plus you can choose from their three types of tortillas!
author: Brianne T.

description:
OK - we called in an order to be picked up.  The guy told me 10 to 15 minutes...cool.  We headed there in about 15 minutes, got out...got to the register and said that we are picking up the order.  The guy pulls the ticket and says, OK we will make it now....so what is the purpose of telling me 10 to 15 minutes?  There was no line and the place is not packed, so what the heck?

OK we got 4 items, 2 burritos (carnitas); carne asada taco and a chicken nachos.  All the items had good flavor, but both burritos were really loosely wrapped...one bite and the burritos were spilling its guts all over the plate.

I would go to Gordos instead, at least the pick up orders are ready when you get there.
author: Jerry W.

description: Just a short review...The food was good enough for what it was...The people working there though are pretty grumpy. Mostly just grunts and defiantly no formalities, like not even a hello. Pretty sure that we wont return.
author: Nicolle S.

description: I love coming to this place for the Super Taco which is basically a mini burrito but cheaper. It's still enough food to fill me up. Plus it's great getting chips and using them to scoop out the goodness.
author: Laura K.

description:
The worst burrito ever! In super veggie burrito there was neither guacamole  nor salsa present, only rice and beans and a little bit of sour cream. When I mentioned it to the staff they just smiled at me.
Would not come back!
author: Lacrimosa L.

description: Updating just to say that after 8 years of coming here, it is still perfect, and the guys truly treat me like family when I come in. I love Chino's!
author: Morgan B.

description: This is a super solid burrito shop in the neighborhood. The guys that work there are super nice and patient taking orders from the kiddos practicing their Spanish. I do feel like it's a bit expensive compared to some spots in the Mission but I continue to give them my money!
author: Jessica B.

description: One of the best Mexican food places I've tried, their spicy chicken burrito/plate is really good. Cheap too!
author: Ahmed A.

description: It has a very nice authentic feel to the place. The service is very nice and the food is reasonably priced, notably cheaper than a place such as Chipotle, and the quality of the food is just as high if not better. It's a very solid place to go for Mexican food.
author: Cindy G.

description: I LOVE CHINOS! This place is super cheap, and the food is GOOD. The guys working here are so friendly and cool.
author: Emily D.

description:
This Balboa Burrito Bastion managed to disprove the time-tested adage "any burrito is better then no burrito". My super spicy chicken burrito's (6.40$) failures were legion: The ungrilled tortilla developed early leaks followed by complete burstage 2/3 of the way through, which resulted in the burrito being eaten horizontally (in a style befitting a hoagie, not a burrito!), and the consumption of several slow-growth forests worth of napkins. Cheese was barely present, spice non-existant, even with the addition of a loving handful of Jalapenos, and the "spicy chicken" not only lacked all spice but managed to taste almost fishy. Where was the guacamole I ordered? Nowhere to be found in the damn thing. Was it at least sized well? If I was on a diet the diminuative sizing would have been perfect, as such, it barely lasted 10 bites. 

Not all was bad, however, the ingredient mix was respectable, the rice flavorful, and the re-fried beans pleasantly pasty, but these shouldn't be burrito-defining elements by any stretch of the imagination.

Nothing to see here, folks. Move along.
author: Casey U.

description:
My zone is equidistant to this and Gordos on Clement and this place is better. The spicy chicken super burrito w/e'rrything is RL good. 

They make everything right in front of you, their ingredients are quality, the food's ready almost instantly and the cooks are good (so even if you are in line it will evaporate fast). 

The food is just below Farolitos but that place is dirty and far from me and neither is a place to chill or hang out in anyway.

So to reiterate-

1.) close to me
2.) good
3.) fast
4.) clean
author: Ethan S.

description:
Been here a couple times. The Super burrito is pretty solid. I recommend the spicy chicken and pairing it with a salsa Verde. 

You also have choices of different types of tortillas so make sure to ask about them. 

They  have jarritos to drink which are pineapple/watermelon/lime flavored sodas. They're a bit overpriced but refreshing.
author: Ryuta O.

description: just one star for effort. ..none real méxican would approve this mess,sorry...my husband is güero.. and he prepared a delightful ones...just saying. .wuakalas
author: Jakuna M.

description: Best burritos. They make them super quick and they're delish!
author: Elvisa S.

description:
I don't know about the rest of the menu, but the Spicy Chicken burrito was AWESOME!  I liked that the menu was simple and I received my food within just a couple minutes of ordering.

I highly recommend this as your taqueria of choice if you're in the Golden Gate Park area.  You'll walk away full and happy.
author: S G.

description: Prices have been increasing over the years and it's starting to get really expensive.  It's about $10 for some fully loaded nachos now.  The only reason I come back is because I don't know of any other places in the area that sell nachos.  They also really skimp on the guac and sour cream.  I prefer gordos, but they don't serve nachos there so I'm stuck coming back here when I don't want to drive all the way out to the mission.
author: Tina L.

description:
REVIEW FOR NACHOS ONLY.

I love their super nachos with spicy chicken w/ everything & jalapenos. I've tried it with other meats, but didn't enjoy it as much. I don't think i've had nachos like this anywhere else.
author: Tina S.

description:
I walked to this place to get take out. Maybe if I ate it there it would be better. But I wasn't impressed at all.

First, for the cost, there should be more of certain types of food, like sour cream or guacamole. The amount he put on was about the size of a teaspoon. I had to ask for an extra side.

The chips were completely soggy when I got home and just a big pile of mush. The overall nachos were pretty cold. Again, this could be because I ordered take out. But I'm not big on eating in a place where I can take it out.

The place is pretty big and there are definitely spots to sit and eat. But I did not. Maybe next time I will.

The nachos, in taste, were average at best. With soggy chips, rather bland tasting food, and small amounts of the good stuff, overall, the nachos were just... forgettable. 

I'm not tempted to go and try their other foods. I think that'll be my last time going there.
author: Janice H.

description: Great for a quick burrito. This place is timeless. I think the same three guys have worked here for the 4 years iv been going here. They will always smile and thank you for your business. I recommend this place to all who are after a good burrito.
author: Nathan B.

description: what an amazing place much better than Gordo love their huge tacos are delish will always go when i want mexican
author: Hayden M.

description:
Okay I've been meaning to write an update for this place for a long time. After having eaten at several taquerias I change my mind about this place entirely. Their meats are seasoned nicely, the prices are very low, and their food is good!  It's a simple menu of tacos, burritos, nachos, and quesadillas, so it hits the spot 95% of the time. 

Also, and perhaps more importantly, their staff are FRIENDLY. At most taquerias, employees seem to run on autopilot. For example, they'd ask "What kind of beans" and then slap refried beans onto your food before you even have time to answer. At Chino's, they'll ask you what you want, and wait for you to respond, and then actually give you what you want. I know that doesn't sound like a big deal but for me, it's a huge edge over the much-beloved Gordo's Taqueria (a love that I will never comprehend, for I find their food kinda bland).
author: Dwigt S.

description:
So disappointed in this place. I got the "vegetarian" burrito, which is really just beans, rice and pico. They don't put in anything extra to substitute the meat, which is a HUGE pet peeve of mine. It's the lazy way of making something vegetarian!

That being said, my "vegetarian" burrito was pretty bland and boring from the missing flavors. I highly suggest they create a seasoned bell pepper mix  or something for their veg-friendly clients. Also, I might be mistaken, but I didn't see or get any limes with my food...

I probably won't be returning unless I get really desperate.
author: Devanny N.

description: In regards to the food it was good. The thing that got me was my roommate and I ordered a "super" which comes with quac and sour cream. We asked for it on the side and the gentlemen filled up the containers. Then when we went to check out my meal was $5 more then what the pricing menu said. The check out guy said its because I got much more sour cream and gauc then what's normally given. I stated that I didn't ask the employee to fill them up and since he did it on his own paying extra didn't seem right. He insisted I pay the higher price. Since there was a line I just paid it and left. However, be aware if you ask for it on the side you might get charged a ridiculous amount extra. While the food was good I probably won't go back here again because if I only have X amount of dollars to spend I don't want to get blindsided again.
author: Jessica S.

description: Signed up on yelp just to write this review.  Everyone is super nice.  They have huge selection of meats and ingredients (that are top notch).  Totally recommend this to anyone who wants a top notch super burrito and you are nearby.
author: Ernest C.

description:
This place disappoints every time! Pretty much SUCKS!

I have given these guys so many chances to make me a good burrito, and a fail every time. Do your self a favor and go down the street to Gordos' on either Geary/19th or Clement/24th and get a much better burrito.

Today I asked for extra pico and the guy gave me a small scoop, when I repeated myself he threw a hissy fit. I must have destabilized the world economy because I wanted an extra scoop of tomatoes. Prior to that he gave me a tiny scoop of carnitas, and then proceeded to shuffle a piece around inside my burrito to make it look like he was adding more. As if they are worried about portions on a super.

I AM DONE WITH THIS PLACE!
author: Alex K.

description:
My favorite burrito in SF! 

Super friendly people. Super nice and chill. Low-key and down to earth. Those who have something stuck up their butts, can stay away. 

They have always kept things the same for years -great food, people and a simple place to hangout and eat. 

I always get the carne asada super burrito plus chips and guacamole. You must get the guacamole on side, another all-time favorite! I've also had the spicy chicken! Awesome burritos! Love you guys!
author: J C.

description: Great vegetarian burritos (and their meats looked good), great horchata, friendly staff. Fast, simple, delicious.
author: Zoe J.

description: Outstanding. Living in the central Richmond most people think Gordo for a burrito. To those folks I say "Gordo who?" Chinos offers a much better deal, more food and great, friendly service. I'm a fan for life.
author: Elliott B.

description:
I've been coming to chinos for 15+ years. 

Get the spicy chicken super burrito.   Yeah buddy!

They have good pico de gallo and awesome guacamole.
author: Yevgeniy S.

description: My whole family thinks chino's super spicy chicken burritos are the best. They are perfectly moist as we don't like dry tasting burritos, but I still like to ask for extra salsa on the side. I think their pricing is very reasonable especially when compared to the dry tasteless burritos at Chipotles. And even some of the ones in the missions aren't as good or as reasonable in price. We live in inner sunset but will drive over for their burritos. It's that good!
author: christine k.

description: This place is coo. Me and my boy Lukes hit this place up after snatchin some Purple Kow. That place was shmack as well. But forreal, this burrito place got the joog. Super burritos for $7 and it got guac?! Whatttttt?! Not the best super burrito, but it's coo for $7.
author: Cary T.

description: This is My favorite burrito in the whole entire world! It's the same owners I believe as Ocean Taqueria. The only thing I would change is the following: add habanero salsa, beer, and the freshly grilled chicken to the menu. We will be there every week ha ha.
author: Mel F.

description:
Back in the 90's before I realized what was a good burrito, I thought this place was good. Now after eating at several different places I realized that this was pretty crappy of a burrito. 

The place is big, but no matter what the temperature was outside, had flies in the places.
author: M C.

description: Tasty neighborhood joint.  I had the chicken tacos which were messy and good. The rest of table had burritos and i wish i had followed suit.
author: Susan N.

description:
Decent place for Mexican food if you're in the area and craving a burrito, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. 
Came here last night with the bf who was craving a burrito. I ordered a quesadilla and the first guy behind the counter sprinkled some cheese and tossed the tortilla onto the grill, quesadilla-shaped. Second guy picked up the tortilla and added in the rest of the ingredients, but rolled it into a burrito :(. I don't know why I don't like burritos and like tacos/quesdillas if it's all the same stuff, don't ask! Anyway, I did enjoy my unexpected burrito, though. Cheese/carne asada was good and I like that they have spinach and tomato tortillas, though I doubt there's any additional nutritional value in those. I do like the color green and pretending to be healthy, so I had a spinach tortilla. Anyway, they kind of skimp on the guac and the hot sauce they added wasn't too hot. 
There's no counter where you can add additional sauces and random little things. Were too many people stealing carrots and limes? Who knows. 
It's just your typical hole-in-the-wall place. You can eat your food quickly or get it to-go. Service was pretty good and prices are decent for SF.
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
A decent place for a burrito. Came here on a recommendation from a friend, but wasn't really impressed. I got the pollo asada super burrito. The prices are very decent but I'd rather pay a little more for a better burrito. Unlike most places, their chicken was already grilled and they didn't freshly grill it when you order it. The rice was very, very bland. The burrito was also wrapped poorly... it was very loose and practically fell apart in my hands.

However, with that price, if I'm ever in that neighborhood and only have a few bucks on me, then I'd give it another try. There are just way too many taquerias in the city to eat at (nobody beats El Faro, still)... with so many choices I tend to get a little more picky.
author: Sara K.

description:
...what in the world......

whatever planet all these good reviews fell off of was obviously lacking in mexican food. I understand that there is no other mexican food around, but that doesnt make this place 'good' by default. the people working in here are often rude, and while the prices are pretty big for a taqueria like this, they're skimpy on the ingredients. Been living in the area with my family most of my life, and the consensus is....make the drive to gordo's.  unless you're starving and need of mexican food and your palate doesn't really know the difference. 

I gave 'em an extra star because as a kid, i loved their quesadillas. I have since been exposed to real quesadillas.
author: Alana V.

description:
I remember when I first was told that I had to try Chino's 10 years ago, we went that very day and we were hooked!  There's something about Chino's and the way they prepare all the ingredients that is pretty darn amazing. 

Now that I have moved to the Sunset I have been trying every Taqueira to see if any can even compare and all I can say is a big fat NO!! So of course on Wednesday I had to venture to Outer Richmond to get me and the little guy a great burrito. It was just as it has been amazing!

I have tried all the meats here the spicy chicken and chile verde are my favorites and you can't go wrong with extra hot sauce and jalapenos on that burrito! Also they will prepare your food just how you want it so when the little guy was picky and wanted everything in separate containers it was never a problem. 

I have now given up on trying to find a place to replace my Chino's because nothing can compare.

The only con I can think of is it is a cash only place so make sure you bring cash otherwise the cafe down the street has a little atm inside.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Chino's for the win. Again. Just had one of their carnitas burritos with spicy sauce. It was oh so good. The guy working behind the counter made sure the meat was drained before making the burrito, so it didn't turn into an unholy mess while eating it. He was also very nice to a dad with his two young daughters, making sure the little girls got exactly what they wanted on their quesadilla.

As always it was good food at a good value.

I only wish they made breakfast burritos.
author: Monarch B.

description: This may not be the best burrito in the world, but it is to me. I've been stopping by here for maybe 10 years now, and what I love about Chino's is the texture. I've never suffered the indignity of a crunchy tortilla here, and I'm forever grateful. Every tortilla is properly steamed, allowing for a chewy chunk of awesome for you to cram down your food hole. My only issue is that they don't take credit card, and I rarely use cash anymore. Nevertheless, I hope Chino's is still around in another 10 years.
author: Ashish B.

description: This place is really top notch. Now I know it's no mission burrito but in my eyes it's pretty darn close. The burritos are the size of your head!!! They give you so much meat and it's all delicious. Great service and the owner is super nice. I live in the area and this is my go to for a burrito out by the beach.
author: Mike M.

description: Not the best taqueria in the city but low key and good enough to keep going back. It's hard to find a decent taqueria except for Gordos in the Sunset, so it's nice to know about this one! Regular Grilled Chicken Burrito, Cheese, Black Beans, Rice and Salsa (red & green) Just stick with a regular flour tortilla!
author: Matthew F.

description: Chino's is a good neighborhood place, especially when you're just craving Mexican food.  The atmosphere isn't amazing, and the food isn't out-of-this-world, but it's just a solid place to go for a good burrito.  Although I will have to say, I went there craving nachos and was blown away by how excellent their super nachos were.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I am sure I won't be long before I come in to Chino's.
author: Gabrielle L.

description: Like some other yelpers, I've only had the spicy chicken burrito here and it was very tasty. The spice varies from time to time. Once it was so spicy that I couldn't finish (rare for me) and had to take breathers throughout and order a second drink (perhaps a clever marketing ploy :) ). It's very inexpensive and great for a quick dinner. This was one of my introductory restaurants upon moving to San Francisco. We walked down 33rd and turned down Balboa to find everything shrouded in fog and the lights along the street a blur. I loved it instantly!
author: Sharon G.

description: Solid burritos, especially for the outer Richmond which is pretty lacking in decent Mexican food.
author: Eric C.

description:
Not bad for a neighborhood taqueria, but don't waste your time making a special effort coming here for a burrito, taco, quesadilla, nachos or a rice cup. I've tried all the meats and chicken variations, and the only one I like is grilled chicken.

Cash ONLY!
author: Ryan L.

description:
The quesadillas are very good.    Tacos are blander than you'd expect.   
The line moves quickly.    And remember its cash only.   
Two people can eat really well for twenty bucks.     But they could use some serious cleaning service around the tables.    
Good Mexican for s good price.
author: chris b.

description:
I've been coming to Chino's since I moved to the outer Richmond 9.5 years ago.  I love it.  I eat here about once a week.  It is a TRUE hole in the wall, and the ambiance is SORELY LACKING.   A bit rundown but not dirty.  The guys that work here are awesome.  Seriously a nicer group of dudes do not exist.

My older kids have gone on occasion by themselves and found themselves a bit short on cash.  They've then given them the good neighbor discount and taken the money they have even if they are short.

Yes, you have to pay for chips but god know you don't need them after eating a burrito the size of your head.

For a taqueria in the avenues, it can't be beat.

(As for the food itself, it's fast and yummy-not quite at the standards of places in the Mission but still great and kicks the butt of Gordo's in my opinion.)
author: Bianca G.

description: I love Chinos! These guys are alright! They are friendly and funny, and they make good Mexican fast food.  They are there to please .  All the meats are cook right not to much grease and they go that extra step.  The prices are good too Please go  and try them out. There are not many authentic Mexican Taqueria in the outer Richmond. Plus this is not a franchise but a family business, go check them out and tell them the El Tejano sent you ( Miquel)
author: Susie S.

description:
Chino's has that sketchy, hepatitis-y look to it that usually signals the presence of serious Mexican food. Alas and alack, it is not to be found here. 

We had a chicken burrito, a carnitas burrito and an order of carne asada nachos. Impression: Meh. Everything was bland and boring, utterly forgettable.
author: Todd H.

description: chinos is the best out here in the outer Richmond, inner Richmond too. their spicy chicken is flavorful and best nachos I've had! the guys are really great and funny as well
author: Vivian H.

description: Absolutely amazing burritos and quesadillas. The chicken is tasty by itself and the service is friendly. You can watch them make your food and handmade tortilla chips. Great price for everything as well! This is my new favorite Mexican food place in SF.
author: Kat E.

description: Similar to Gordos' super burrito. The quesadilla is more tasty. I like their green sauce better for its chunkiness. The difference is that they put lettuce in their burritos.
author: Jennie W.

description:
My absolute FAVORITE mexican food place by far.  My husband and I have been coming here for 15 years, since we were high school students just up the street.  With that being said, try to avoid coming during the lunch hour on a weekday or expect to wait alongside 20 or so rowdy teenagers.  But that also implies that they have reasonable prices.

I judge a mexican joint by their guacamole and their's is one of my faves.  Be sure to grab a little bag of chips (50 cents) with your burrito and guac, you won't regret it.  They're thin and super crispy.

We love the guys behind the counter, they still remember us from 15 years ago!  We love you Chino's!
author: Alice L.

description: Chinos is great!!! The burritos and nachos are excellent and delicious. The quesadillas are amazing! The carnitas is the best in town. The people there are very nice and friendly. Great for lunch and dinner if your in a rush. My family and I love this place! Great neighborhood taqueria.
author: Linda Y.

description:
Went here for lunch today - ordered 2 super carne asada tacos ($3.60 each). The tortillas stuck to the wax paper they put on top of the plate making it impossible to pick up and made using a fork necessary. The steak was flavorless and rubbery in texture - the rest of the taco filling was "slop" beans, cheese, weak salsa, and a lot of juice

No me gusta la comida de Chico's
author: Bumble B.

description:
Chino's Taqueria has been around the Outer Richmond district for a long time.  This area of Balboa Street from 35th to 38th avenue has seen new life in the last five years (near Balboa theater).  Lucky for Chino's the nearest taqueria is Gordo's at 19th & Geary Blvd.  

The other day we picked-up two super burritos & a cheese quesadilla.  Prices at Chino's are fair super burritos $5.50 and cheese quesadilla's $2.50.  That would explain the line out the door at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon.  Service was fast order and out the door in five minutes.

Not much to look at from the inside.  A salsa bar and some minor upgrade in the dinning area would be great.  For a quick taqueria fix it's OK 2.5 stars, but I prefer Tropisueño... :)'
author: Rich W.

description:
Friendly, quick,  inexpensive.
There's always seating, and the carnitas is really tasty.
It's nice to have a decent place that far out in the Richmond.
author: Ken B.

description:
I was in the outer-Richmond District to do some work. And for lunch, we (my work-partner and I) landed one of my earlier bookmarked businesses. I don't come out to the outer Richmond often and I thought I gave this place a shot.

Chino taqueria... hmmm...Sounds like a Chinese-owned taqueria; a very interesting name to call a taqueria. 

There are three kinds of meat: grilled steak, chicken, and carnitas. I had the cooked chicken in regular burrito. In addition to the standard flour tortilla, the taqueria offers three kinds of tortillas: Pesto, Sundried Tomato and Wheat. I chose the Pesto for my silver-bullet. My $5.25 burrito has the meat, rice and salsa. They also have lettuce as one of the filling, but I strongly oppose having lettuce in my burrito.  I wanted cheese in my burrito and they charge $.50 extra. 

Maybe I should've put lettuce in my burrito, because the burrito was very bland. The chicken pieces were also dry as a bone. After eating only half, I couldn't eat that burrito no more. 

I paid my co-worker's meal and mine in cash, because my co-worker forgot to go to the ATM machine and this place is "cash only". If my co-worker wants to return the favor and reimburse my meal, I hope it won't be this place. 

I usually rely on Yelp for recommendations for our meal, but this time I'm going to strongly disagree with Yelp about this place, considering this place has a not one, not two, but three Yelp stickers on the main entrance door. In my book, they don't deserve any Yelp sticker.
author: Matt G.

description:
Man.. as a wee lil toddler at the youthful age of 16, i use to come here during my lunch hours for all my burrito needs. this place is fantastic. I love their burritos, i love their quesadillas, i love their nachos with carne asada. cheeeese expllosion everywhere. freakin delicious gatdammit dabnabbit! 

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description: Great taqueria that i've been going to for ages. Their carnitas and spicy carnitas are to die for and they are always so kind and cheerful there too. Gordos doesn't even compare
author: David G.

description: Quesadilla is more like a burrito here, first place I've seen where they put rice,beans and onions in Quesadilla plus it costed $10.50 with tax............Not worth it personally.
author: Kanish L.

description:
Spicy chicken burritos. Damn... carnitas are delish too. 

best spot to get a burrito in the outer rich. do it.
author: Matt Z.

description:
Oh my God!

Get their delux carne asada taco with melted cheese on the corn tortilla, guacamole and sour cream!

I love this place!
author: Anelya S.

description:
I'm pro-Chino's. I've had huge angry debates over Chino's v. Gordo's. Don't even get me started! Chino's is the home of RIDICULOUS succulent BEAUTIFUL carnitas (not salty, only tender), tomato and spinach tortillas, orgasmic nachos (lovin' it with extra queso), and the gentlemen that are behind the counter are always smiling (or is that just because I'm cute? Harhar). I find the dining area to be a bit drafty, so I prefer curling up in front of my television with a dangerously delicious burrito... watching Lost on DVD, wishing that I hadn't eaten the whole thing, but managing to be relatively optimistic about my temporary state of obesity. (Pause) Gordo's doesn't even have refried beans, you know.*


*According to the last time I looked at their menu, which I'm unashamed to say was probably 3+ years ago.
author: Natasha P.

description: My husband has been going here for 10+ years. When we were moving to the east bay, he was worried what he'd so without Chinos. Sometimes we'll take the baby & go for a road trip to SF just to get chinos. They only take cash, which is annoying but by far THE BEST!
author: Alina S.

description:
I'll make this painfully short.

Ordered two vegetarian burritos to share.

1) gave my girlfriend diarrhea.
2) gave us both sulfur smelling bad gas.
3) They had a very bland taste to them.

Only upside is that they're cheap ( ~$4.60 per, including quacamole). 


Are you willing to take the risk?
author: Shaun D.

description: The most delicious burrito I've ever eaten, hands down. Worth the trek!
author: Eliza D.

description: Not sure what people are eating here. I had a carnitas plate and the meat was dry, flavorless and chrispy. If you're in the hood skip it and hit one of the asian places.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Only 3 and 1/2 stars? Really? Well, looking through the reviews it looks like people either hate it (one star) or love it (five stars). I love it.

Let me preface this: i have been going here for five years now, and absolutely love the burritos, BUT the burritos are pretty wet, which I'm into, but throws some people off. Super veggie? wonderful. Spicy chicken? amazing. Carnitas? yum. 

Seriously, I prefer chino's burritos to any other taqueria in the city (even in the mission). I come here at least once a week, and think its super legit. 

Definitely get the red hot sauce.

My only wish? A SALSA BAR & FREE CHIPS!
author: Jamie J.

description:
Look, my review is not helpful for people looking for the best burrito in San Francisco. It isn't here.

What is here?....hmmm. I grew up on 39th and Balboa. This was my local place; not just local place, but my weekend treat. An SNES game rented from Poppa Opps and a Super burrito from Chino's was just too good.

I went back a couple summers; it's as good as any. Plus the nostalgia factor?

3.5 for anyone, it's well worth checking out. 5/5 if you're me or anyone else who grew up in the Outer Richmond. My first review, just 'cause I fucking love this place!
author: Shane M.

description: I enjoy burritos from Chinos every time that I am in SF.  I get the chile colorado, spicy chicken or carne asada burrito.  I am so glad that Chinos is in the Outer Richmond.
author: Karen S.

description: Merh. Just merh. I don't know how else to explain the food. I'm from LA, lived in San Diego for a couple of months, and just moved to the Bay Area last month. I was craving Mexican food and this was the only nearby restaurant in my area so I decided to give them a try. Judging by the yelpers reviews,it's either a hit or miss. And for me, a huge miss! I grew up in heavily influenced Hispanic neighborhoods so I know a good taco. I ordered two asada tacos ("super") meaning they put a bunch of crap in it to make it somewhat decent tasting which I think even if you get it plain or whatever it still wouldn't have tasted good. I added an extra star for the portion which was fairly large. But I was expecting the little yummy street tacos I'm used to! The guys working were super nice!
