boku no iie kara chotto nagai sanpou desu kedo, minna tenin honma yasashii desu yo!!!  fuck you Paco!!!  i am coming here today to order 2 super burritos and i will tip an amount equal to what i pay..just to spite your ass.

the tastes here are more juicy, flavorful and 4 different tortillas to choose from over Gordo on clement(which SUCKS!)

hahahha!!!! (why am I laughing??)
author: omar b.

description: The Burritos aren't super special, but they make it quick and its relatively inexpensive 5-6~. I never really tried much of the other meats but i do like the burrito with pinto, grilled chicken deal. Not too bad, and i live pretty close if you want a good fix.
author: J C.

description: Pretty darn good for what it is - a dive burrito place on balboa with hefty size burritos for a descent price.  Staff was friendly enough, all they had to do was make a burrito and hand it to me- mission accomplished.  I try to duck in here when working in the area to grab a quick dinner.  They load them up and you definitely get your money's worth. CASH ONLY.
author: Owen S.

description: $5.50 for a burrito! I am a fan. My man got the burrito with the spicy chicken (not too spicy but the chicken is boiled to perfection) and my grilled steak and chicken burrito was also grilled with love. Very good and busy for a hidden hole in the wall Taqueria on balboa on a Tuesday night.
author: Ashley M.

description: I stopped by Chino's on Saturday afternoon after The City golf championship.  What better way to celebrate a win with a great burrito.  A friend of mine that used to live in the area recommended this spot so off we went.  I had a burrito with plain chicken and it was quite good.  The chicken quality was high, if you know me I scrutinize this quite closely.  Bad chicken has made axed certain spots from my list.  Overall the meal was excellent, salsa not to spicey and all the flavors worked really well.  Above average taqueiria and worth driving an extra 5 minutes.
author: Jimmy M.

description: I used to go to Chino's when I was in high school.  I had fond memories of their quesadillas stuffed with the works and when I had one that wasn't so good at a taqueria whose name I won't mention, I knew I HAD to go back to Chino's to get that bad taste out of my mouth.  It's everything that I remember...tasty ingredients (and their carnitas isn't too salty), fast service and overall authentic.  Another plus, there's plenty of seats.  It's too bad that Chino's is a bit far and I live closer to other good taquerias, but I have a feeling I'll make the trek when I'm jonesn' for a good quesadilla with the works.
author: Marie B.

description: I'm pretty sure this used to be a Gordos, but the last time I stepped foot in this place was more than 10 years ago, so I could be wrong. The super burrito was more like super boring; very bland even with "salsa", which I'm sure was killed with the presence of just washed lettuce. There was a constant stream of customers coming in which tells me it's still a neighborhood favorite but where the hell were all the Mexicans? That should've been a sign right there but then again I don't think they'd be going to a place that serves "super" burritos.
author: Jonathan W.

description: This is burrito as comfort food at its best.... Excellent meat, rice and guac.  Low key.  Friendly providers.  What more can you ask for??
author: p w.

description:
Super Carnitas since 1989! Just like the pizza debate, the burrito debate can ignite fistfights. Everyone has their personal fave and lots of emotions are usually involved. My personal fave is Chino's. It saved me from many a hangover (the hot sauce is key!) The best thing about Chino's is this: even though I moved out of the Richmond ages ago, I can still walk in to Chino's and 9 out of ten times, be welcomed back by the folks that work there. Every once in a while they even remember, Super Carnitas, extra hot sauce! Mmmm....
On a side note, years ago, when my sis and I roomed together, we actually got in a fist fight over a left-over burrito nub I stashed in the fridge. I came home drunk and hid it in the back, knowing I would need it for sustenance the next blurry-eyed morning. It so happened that my sis came home right after my passed-out self, drunk also, and sloppily horked down my treasured left over burrito.  The resulting Sunday morning throw-down was worthy of the new American Gladiators. Laila Ali and Hulk Hogan, you are hereby forewarned: keep your hands off my burrito nub, or you will be summarily thrashed within an inch of your life. (Note: you can guess who won the burrito-nub-throw-down. yes, I know how white-trash this story is...)
author: Delilah P.

description: Love this place! I take anyone who visits there. The guys who work there are friendly and quick and the food is awesome. It is always a tough decision between the spicy chicken and the pulled pork but i have never been disappointed. Their tacos are also good and quite big. Chino's is good anytime :)
author: cathryn t.

description: I came here on the recommendation of "short bike rides in and around san francisco."  And I gotta tell you, on a cold day in a neighborhood that seems to be sort of a wasteland, this is an oasis of super burrito goodness.  I had to ingest all of the calories I had just worked so hard to burn off in some fashion, so why not with a delicious burrito?  Good value too!
author: James M.

description: I have been coming to Chino's since 1990. What I like about it, is it has very friendly and wonderful people working there. I also love their tortilla choices and quality. Their burritos are smaller in size than most places, but, for me a good tortilla is very important. I usually get a vegetarian burrito. The prices are a bit too high for the small size burrito that you get. Otherwise, it's delicious, prepared quickly and very convenient. Open 7 days a week til 10pm!
author: Aleksey Z.

description: Best cheap burritos out here in the 'burbs.  Beats the other local Mexican food places that just have mediocre food at high prices.  I get their veggie burritos on a regular basis.  Nothing fancy.  Just good eats.
author: Surf R.

description: Been going to Chino's for years.  Love their carnitas nachos!
author: Alec M.

description: 1-2-3 Chinos! Chinos! Chinos! This is the call of the hungry seal. Chinos is church. If you aren't a believer, then you don't really understand. For beginers, try the super pollo picante (spicy chicken) on whatever tortilla looks good to you amigo. What kinda beans amigo? All kinds. Any kind. They're all kind. Their secret is feshness. That's why they are there every morning early making the beans. The carnitas is excellent as well. I own a Chinos hat. They won't sell them to you. I talked Chino himself into selling me one about 6 years ago. By the way, it's not for sale.
author: Jarad P.

description: I shouldn't even yelp about it...I want it to remain a secret!  I've tried many a burrito here in SF...but Chino's has the best!  The tortilla isn't greasy, and the cheese is minimal...doesn't feel like it's giving you a heart attack.  The carne asada has zero fat on it...and the spicy chicken is so flavorful.  And the guys working there are the BEST...so friendly and fast.  Love them!  Oh, and they have beer...sweet beer.
author: Adrea F.

description: Considering that we're WAYYYYY out in the outer Richmond (seriously, people, it's one bus ride (on any of three buses) away from downtown), this is a pretty damn good burrito place.  If you're hungry, definitely order a platter, they're American-man-size.  Tacos are always filled to bursting. Nachos can have everything on it so they can resemble exploded burritos, in a good yummy way.  Meal times can mean a good line but only cuz it's good, filling food for a low price.
author: Imelda M.

description: BEST tacos, hands down!  Used to live in the neighborhood and frequented here for a quick and cheap fix.  Chino's is FAR BETTER than most of the taquerias in the city.  Fast, cheap and never too busy, this place is a hidden gem!
author: D F.

description: Chino's is the best taqueria in the Richmond, though many of you already know that if you're craving Mexican, the Richmond is not really the place to go (as opposed to say, the Mission).  I used to live right around the corner from Chino's and though Balboa offers a decent number of restaurants on its street, I found myself at Chino's the most.  It's good food, inexpensive, fast service, friendly, and I always have a full and happy tummy after every meal.  It's a place where you are called Amigo.  Currently living in Emeryville, I miss Chino's!
author: Denise I.

description: I am a HIGE fan of Chino's!  They have the best burrito's.  Very good quality of meat and veggies.  Nothing beats grabing some Chino then going to GG park or the beach!!
author: Russ B.

description:
Great place to drop in for a cheap no-hassle burrito of your design.  Bare--bones, but super spacious seating.  Plenty of drinks to choose from and napkins at arms-length.  Fine place to run in and grab burrito to-go or sit with a buddy and chow down at their tables.  Nicely run place.  
I usually get a burrito with spicy chicken or beef and black beans and the works!
YUM!
Very satisfying meal for less than $10.
author: GG P.

description: Chino has always been on my list of taquerias to eat at during times of hunger. It has also always been one of those "hit or miss" places. It has the right idea and a good selection of different meats and toppings and oftentimes I will get a great burrito from there, but then there are those few times that I have gone there and been extremely unhappy with my food. On more than 5 occasions over the past few years, I have taken a bite out of my burrito and to my disgust, I I end up chomping on a piece of bone or cartlege. Sometimes the rice is dried out as well which takes away from the aesthetic value of the burrito. My most consistent experiences derive from Gordo on 9th avenue (not geary blvd or Pancho Villa in the Mission.
author: John G.

description: I love this place. I probably go to this place more often than all the other restaurants combined! Their super burrito is the way to go. Melted mozzarella cheese with an ample amount of your choice of meat (I recommend chile verde pork), rice, beans, lettuce, salsa, sour cream, and guacamole. Yum! And the price is unbeatable at ~$6. If you live in Outer Richmond, far from Mission where all the other Taquerias are, then this is the place you want to stop by to grab a satisfying burrito.
author: Joyce C.

description: Chino's is great!  I come here often for lunch and their super spiced chicken taco is so good with chips and salsa.  Good place to go for lunch for under $5! Sometimes there's a long line, but it moves quickly and I like that the ingredients are so fresh.
author: Celeste M.

description: Seriously? "Best burrito in SF?" I mean, it was pretty decent but I dunno about the super props from some other Yelpers. What I liked: The spicy chicken (boiled not grilled), the hot salsa, and the atmosphere - it's a dump - which is great for a burrito joint. What I didn't like: bland rice and no-so-cold horchata. If I find myself way out on Balboa, I'd stop in again, but probably wouldn't make the special trip...
author: Kate S.

description: BLAND.  BLAND.  That word comes up again and again in reviews of this place, and I fully have to agree.  This place gets good reviews and stays in business for the same reason businesses stayed open in the Soviet Union. . . lack of goddamn competition.  This makes Gordo look like 5 star food.  I'm only giving it an extra star because parking is usually a little forgiving in the neighborhood.  Nothing like the aroma of floor cleaner to meet you when you walk in everytime.  If this place was in the Mission, these guys would be operating a 99 cent store after a week.
author: Christopher G.

description: 3.5 stars. They're okay...I guess it's because my burrito was rather plain. Then again, it's better than going to like Taco Bell or something. Also, I live close by, so it's pretty the only Mexican place I can go to without transportation.
author: Alex Y.

description:
I always try to find a nearby taqueria that will always fill my burrito craving. And Chino's in the Outter Richmond does it. Located in a quiet neighborhood off Balboa, Nino's is a nice spot. Parking is easy and you can either eat in, there is plenty of seating, or get it to go. 

Menu is simple and to the point. The best part about Chino's is you get to choose from three types of tortillas and then you pick and choose the meat and ingridents of your burrito. Actually see the burrito in the making. I know not some incredible thing but I like this kind of attention to my burrito making process.

Opted for a standard flour tortilla burrito with everything! Left me full like a burrito should be but not in a food coma or running for a toilet.

Four stars for Chino's!
author: David B.

description: Always fast, consistent, cheap and steamed tortillas!!! Another line style point to your ingredients and build your food. Far out but if you are having a day in the park or the ocean this is a place to make yourself full of burritos and nachos. Cash only.
author: William R.

description: I don't really get it, I'm not that impressed by this place.  It's ok, and pretty inexpensive, but I mean, great Mexican food it is not.  If I'm craving a burrito and don't want to leave the Outer Richmond, I'd go here.  If I'm short on time before a movie at the Balboa Theater, I'd go here.   Otherwise, I'd keep on trucking.
author: Gami G.

description: I don't particularly like taquerias; there's something about the way that so much of the food be it burrito or quesadilla ends up tasting the same. Well, Chino's is different. The food they make is quite nice and well worth the visit even if you don't think you're prone to liking little taquerias.
author: Stephen W.

description:
ever been to a Chipotle's? they stole their concept from these guys.

i live in san diego now and was a regular when i lived near 41st and cabrillo a decade ago. even in southern california i STILL dream of these monster burritos! the flavors, all laid out in front of you and smells wafting through the air...  the freshness of it all with nearly all the stuffings made on-site... the overwhelming mass of a burrito you're presented with when you're done slobbering all over the sneeze-guard... a gleaming aluminum log of wholesome goodness wrapped inside (just like a christmas present)... it's enough to make me cry. i stop in whenever i'm in the city.
author: Chuck N.

description: Bland beans, bland meat, bland salsa, bland everything.  I gave this place one chance, and my housemate gave this place 2 chances, and we both agree that this place is not worth our money. How this place got a Yelp sticker, I have no idea.
author: Mellie P.

description: I LOVE CHINO'S. And I swear, it has nothing to do with the fact that I can walk there. The super nachos are amazing (no guac, black beans and lots of hot sauce). I'm both bummed and hyped that they were written up in the Chronicle "Cheap Eats" pullout. It's a no-brainer, though. Chino's is the best taqueria outside the Mission.
author: Sara C.

description: I am a fan of Chino's.  It's a great, reliable spot. Spicy chicken and carnitas are great on a good day and very tasty on an okay day.  If you are in the neighborhood and craving Mexican, Chino's is the best Mexican spot in the Outer Sunset and the Outer Richmond.
author: Mary H.

description: huuuuuge vegetarian burritos for $5! not only are they extremely generous in portions, offer 3 different kinds of tortillas, and don't give any grief when you ask for extra cheese or lettuce...but one massive veg burrito after a night of drinking, and you will be back on your feet in no time! (well you might have to take a nap after you tackle one of these first!)
author: Kaylan S.

description:
a consistent burrito and my default dinner when i'm super busy.  the carnitas is choice.... with black beans, on a spinach tortilla, and everything in it.  oh, delicious chino's carnitas.  i think i may have had this combo 3 times in one week before.

also a big fan of the super nachos (half carne asada/half spicy chicken) but they upped the price a few months back and i haven't been able to justify in my head spending that money for pure fat when i can just go get some hawaiian bbq.

the guys in there are cool and call me "boss" sometimes.  i wonder if it's because i'm chinese?  parking can be a pain, but if you're in a big rush you can just take my reserved spot on the east end of the block in front.  DPT even painted it red for me!
author: Steven C.

description: I say: Chino's Taq. rocks the Outer Richmond. Not the best food in the world, but really good burritos where you have few other choices nearby. I get the spice chicken burrito, chips and salsa. for under $5. Not bad, not bad....
author: Patrick G.

description: Everybody has one.  Or at least hopefully, everyone does.  Your neighborhood Taqueria.  I can say that this place it aight and reliable.  If I really want a kick ass burrito, I won't come here but if I am lazy and don't want to drive too far, Chino's does the job.  Though Gordo's seems to get all the Rave Reviews, I much prefer Chino's over Gordo's....
author: Mark W.

description: The spicy pork is awesome, the carnitas is really really good too.  Prices are great, they make everything right in front of you and really quick, they're really nice guys too.  I can't usually finish a burrito and I'm 200 lb.  Get a taco if you're a little 'un.  Open till 10.  No complaints.  It's not THE best place, I'd give that to Tres Amigos in Half Moon Bay, but it's great to have in the neighborhood.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Yummy, cheap, big portions, what more can you ask for?  I've come here on several occasions when I'm craving for a burrito and the quality of the food has always been consistent.  Can't beat the prices either...a super burrito is about $5 and can easily be shared with a friend.  I'm tempted to give it five stars, I like this place that much, but I should be fair and check out more places in the Mission (have only been to two so far).  But I would say with confidence, you can't find a better Mexican restaurant in the Richmond (not like there's a huge selection anyway).  As a nice bonus, the servers are friendly and smile a lot, giving people the impression that they really enjoy being there.  Makes the whole dining experience that much better when you know your food was made by someone who likes their job.
author: Swirls L.

description: give chino's super nacho's a try. they are awesome, me and all my friends have been their long time customers. Their burriotos are ok! but edible.
author: yana Z.

description: Surprised to see this place is rated so high on Yelp!  My roommate HATES this place but I think its pretty good.  I've definitely had better Mexican food but it does the job if your looking to spend $5.
author: Joel S.

description:
once again, i'm a burrito connoisseur (and partial to burritos from SD).

this place is the epitome of SF burritos.  rice, beans, wrapped in foil and just not as... 'san diego' as a burrito should be.

however it's close, and the people are nice.
author: Ameer N.

description: Hola Amigo! Decent burritos at reasonable prices...what else do you need?
author: Miguel L.

description: Had the spicy chicken burrito.. Should haven called a rice burrito. It was a huge looking burrito, but it was not very spicy, very little chicken, no beans, about 85% rice. Whoever runs this place must have told the guys making the burritos today to make them the cheap way. Rice is the cheapest thing you can put on a burrito, and this one had lots! Maybe they're better on different days, but today was not that day..
author: Henry M.

description: I love the burritos here.  I have been eating them my whole life and they are totally awesome.  When i moved to New York I craved them all the time.  When i moved back to SF they were the first thing i ate. i love burritos and i love chinos! the people there are so nice too
author: Hannah S.

description: Makes you love burritos all over again. Forget about those 'gordos' shops and go the distance for a carnitas burrito that will BRING you there ;)
author: John M.

description: This place is awesome.  They're fast, friendly, and get the job done.  You want sour cream?  You got it.  More rice?  No problem.  Their nachos and burritos are amazing, and I swear eat one after a hangover and you'll feel like you could run a marathon.
author: Courtney K.

description:
downright DELISH! i think rachel ray would even agree. the spicy chicken burrito is bomb, and anything else with spicy chicken in it is equally delectable. extra sour cream and red hot sauce make the burrito what it is, add an orange fanta and youre all set! the guys who work there are friendly and funny, and even gave us free shots of 1800 just because...i'll come back here anytime i can!

(4 starts only because once we went at the end of the night and there was no chicken left, boo. )
author: Sarah C.

description: Consistency is what you can expect from chinos. I have been coming here for a couple years and the food is always the same great taste. The menu is not going to blow your mind with fancy mexican dishes, just the basics. I will take a chinos any day before gordos, the service is much better as well. Good place to get down and dirty with a quality burrtio if you are looking for a quick dinner or lunch.
author: spencer k.

description:
dear lord just thinking about chinos makes me drool.  the carnitas are a.ma.zing! 

the staff is really great too.  sometimes i'm afraid to speak spanish with people but these guys are super chill and don't treat me like some gringa trying to order in spanish to be pretentious (i have felt that way at Gordos and never spoke spanish again!).  we actually have conversations!

the burritos are HUGE though. be prepared to be in a food coma immediately afterwards.  i basically plan my day around chinos.

its great if you live in the neighborhood and don't want to trek all the way down to the mission.
author: Ryan S.

description: When I was back in SF recently, I found myself craving their nachos- so perfect for that Mexican fast food fix.  You get to pick what kind of meat you want (I love the spicy chicken), then you choose what type of beans, and all the fixings- sour cream, salsa, etc., and my favorite- guacamole.  Good, cheap food to satisfy my cravings...what more can I ask for?
author: Audrey T.

description: I love chinos everything is consistently delicious! Everything is always hot and fresh! One of the best buritos out there!
author: Bridget W.

description: Chinos is great. Service is hit or miss, but what do you expect from a place that charges $5 for a burrito? Fantastic burritos!
author: Doug F.

description: Love this place. its as good as a cheap taqueria is going to get.  who cares about the fact that it looks like a jail house cafeteria in mexico.  its good!  the nachos are delish and not many taquerias even serve nachos.  my favorite is the spicy chicken burrito yum.
author: Renee S.

description: Their Carnita Taco's are soooooo good!!!  It's a lot of food too, I will only have to and be completely stuffed.  The outer Richmond is a bit far from where I live but if I'm craving mexican food, I have to come to this place!  It's really cheap too.
author: Brent G.

description: Fantastic veggie burritos. They are very generous with their salsa, guac and sour cream. And they'll know what you want after a handful of trips.
author: JB S.

description: This place is down home. It's been said before, but this is a great, great neighborhood taqueria - the plates are simple but fantastic, and the burritos - authentic or not - are good value. As far as hole-in-the-wall mexican joints go, I suppose it's not the cheapest - but it's worth it. The guys who work here are warm and funny, make you feel like family when you walk in the door the 2nd, 3rd, 100th time.
author: kt s.

description: I L-O-V-E Chino's!  Best burritos in San Francisco!  I trek out there from the Castro at least once a week to savor the mouth-watering taqueria goodness.
author: clover s.

description:
I love this place.  Living in the Richmond District, I have two places to go whenever I'm itching for a burrito:  Gordo's or Chino's.  For me, Gordo's is more of a McDonalds, while Chino's is like an In-N-Out.  In other words, for some weird strange, I consider Chino's to be more "classy", if you will.  So if it's just a regular, normal day, I'll go to Gordo's.  But for Christmas or my birthday?  Chino's time. 

Spicy chicken is awesome.
author: Yelsel T.

description: The only thing I've ever eaten here are their burritos, but they are fabulous. I have yet to be disappointed. They have a great selection of fillings, and somehow manage to mix them so you get a little of each in every bite. Just don't go at noon during the week cause you will wait behind the school kids on their lunch hour.
author: Michelle O.

description: Fast, friendly service, but I usually go after 8pm.  Tasty food and reasonably priced.  And they stay open late -- 10pm.  Just get there before 9:15pm if you want nachos.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description: Excellent burritos, tacos that are bursting from overfilling and good horchata. On occasion the line gets pretty long but mostly because people that have never ordered a burrito before (how does that happen living in California??) are asking "how hot are them hall-a-peenos?" and other madness. Prices are low and if you go there often the guys get to know you and have your order down pat.
author: Robert K.

description: One of my favorites. It's great you can choose from all those delicious meats. Which all are badass. I usually go for some random tortilla. I like spinach sometimes and sun dried other days. There quesadilla is monsterously big. The people are insanely friendly and patient. Especially when people like me can't figure out what you want to eat. They have a very good selection of sodas. They make it to order and at each step of the way they make sure you get what you want in your nacho, buritto, quesadilla, or whatever. Everyone that hit's Balboa should try this place out then get a tasty cup of coffee or beer next store over.
author: Mike W.

description: I had the super nachos and it was a pleasant meal, although not as fully indulgent as other nachos I have had. It was well balanced with not too much cheese nor meat, but still a good amount. The salsa fresca was great and the chips were very good.
author: O S.

description:
I love Chinos because I am never dissapointed when I order my whole wheat tortilla vegetarian burrito, extra guac, extra sour cream, no rice (ok, I'm a little weird). And when I stray away from my regular to get nachos (off the hook), quesedilla or a more exciting burrito, it's ALWAYS good. 

I've been coming here since I was 6 years old and it's only gotten better. And for those Richmondites who prefer Gordos (yes there's a little bit of a rivalry) there is really no comparison. The Chinos guys are so nice and you actually feel like they are your friends. Or at least I do ;-)

Yay, Chinos, keep your yelp sticker!
author: Evelyn B.

description: I stumbled by the place after reading about it on the sfgate website. This place is right by my work at the hospital and i drop by once every few weeks to pick up a spciy chicken burrito before i head home after work.  The burritos here are not bad and definately will fill you up if you are hungry.  I use to frequent the burrito joint on Taravel quite often, but since i have found this place i have been eating here more and more often.
author: Stephen C.

description: I had a nice burrito for lunch here today. The menu is not extensive, but once you order your regular or super burrito, you get choices like the kinds of beans or meat, etc. All rolled up in a delicate tortilla -- this is good, because one doesn't want too much tortilla getting in the way of tasting the fillings, but mine did self destruct all over the table - which was kind of embarassing, considering I was on a date. (Certainly my fault and not the restaurant's though!) The place looks a little sketchy from the outside, but isn't bad on the inside. I'm glad it's in my neighborhood so I can go back often for a burrito fix.
author: Caitlin H.

description: $6 for a super burrito and extremely friendly staff. Plus, you get to choose which type of tortilla you want (spinach, plain, or that red one). I want to give them 5 stars so badly because everyone who works there is so nice, but their burritos are a little on the plain side. Not sure if it's the rice or the meat or maybe even the cheese they put on mine, but something is slacking in the flavor department.
author: Heidi L.

description: I love Chino's.  I eat here at least once/week.  Of course, all I ever get are the vegetarian burritos, but their beans are never mushy, which is a huge plus!
author: Methanie D.

description: I love this place, the guys who run it, and their food so much. Sometimes I stop buy just for the guacamole (fresh, no lime, so it has to be eaten right away) and toasted chips.
author: Christina M.

description: I REALLY wanted to like Chino's.  Recently relocated from new York city where the taquerias are run by Chinese families using American chesses and microwaves I was pulling for Chino's to have the great Mexican food I've been missing. Especially given the fact they are few Mexican options in the area.  I've been three times now and  each time was a disappointment. Their food is BLAND.  The chicken was flavorless, the carne asada was tough and fatty, even the nachos were bad. How do you mess up nachos? Que pasa Chino?
author: lisa g.

description: Been going here since it was the perfect after surf stop back in high school. Now its a favorite of my kids. For a great, well priced burrito, that doesn't leave you in a coma, it doesn't get any better.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Dank mexican close to the set...nicely priced too.
Nik
author: Nikolai S.

description: in the outer richmond your choices of mexican are very limited. luckily there is chinos.
author: Andrew D.

description: not a bad place to grab quick mex considering its the only taqueria near my neighborhood. of course it doesnt compare to the mission spots but it's decent enough.
author: Sandy F.

description: Been here a few times.  Spartan surroundings, but the burritos are terrific.
author: Le C.

description: You get more than what you pay for; they give you a lot! The place looks small from the outside but it's actually pretty big on the inside. They have tables for you to eat in and the guys there are cool. Good variety. The guacamole is gooood, you can smell it once you walk in.
author: carlos r.

description: I love Chinos.  Everything is super good so it's hard to recommend any particular thing, thus the only comment I have is on the staff.  There's a little guy and a big guy that makes the food on different nights.  The little guy is very nice and polite and professional, but the big guy if often surly and has some sort of an attitude that permeates.  Every single time.  It's not me in particular as others at the coffee shop next door have mentioned it as well.  Dude, what is up with you?  We are customers there to make your life better.  Why act like we did something wrong by stepping through the door?  Taking away one star because of this guy.
author: Missy L.

description: I've  been coming here for 6 years since I was a student at GWHS down the street. This is my favorite Mexican place in SF. Their burritos are bigger than average and always delicious. But the nachos have got to be my favorite. Oh the crispy nacho with grilled chicken. The staff is always friendly and I usually see a line out the door. I've never had a bad experience here and recommend it for some delicious fun.
author: Tatiana T.

description: I've only been to Chino's a couple of times.  But I love their carnitas!  You can really taste the bacony flavor!  YUM!
author: Holly W.

description: Having grown up in the Richmond and going to grade school at St. Monica's, my friends and I would frequent Gordo's after school so it became a staple in my diet.  I loved Gordo's and notice that I said "loved" not love, as in the past tense.  I can't remember when I discovered Chino's but I am glad that I did because the food at Chino's is much better than Gordo's.  I can't really explain it, but Chino's burritos taste much cleaner than any burrito I have ever eaten.  There is just something really fresh about the ingredients that they use.  Case in point: I had a Chino plate today and the pico de gallo was on the side and you can tell by looking at it that they chopped everything by hand and not in a food processor which a lot of places tend to do.  So you know that there is a lot of TLC put into their food which sets them apart from the millions of taquerias in the city.  And seriously, they have the best carnitas in the city.  The carne asada I will admit that I have had better elsewhere, but it isn't bad and I  will kill for their fried pork!
author: Ben M.

description: this place is awesome... love to get a carne asada spinach tortilla burrito w/ everything to go.. YUMMM... even the hot sauce they put in it is actually hott.. and very very goood!!! i totally recommend trying.. fyi. it is cash only..
author: Ericka P.

description: i live near a gordo's but yet i find my self driving out to chino's. the parking sucks but everything is well worth it. the nacho's are awesome.
author: Justin W.

description: nothing in the menu is quite spectacular.  the prices are fair and it's a nice stop by once in awhile since i live in the neighborhood.
author: Amy Z.

description: This place doesn't seem to have any hot sauce, which my burrito definitely needed this afternoon. I only go here because it's close to my apartment... it's not horrible, but you can definitely do better in San Francisco.
author: a a.

description: I was brought here by friends who raved about the quality of the food. I was disappointed. It was an average sized, underseasoned burrito. In a town with so many Mexican options, you're going to have to do better than that. Some day I'm sure I'll give them another try, but until then, two stars.
author: Matt G.

description: I only order one thing here: the quesadilla. It's my comfort food. I know that it may not be the best "authentic" place like Pancho Villa's but the food is fresh, the place is relatively clean, and the guys that work here are so sweet and friendly.
author: Olivia B.

description: The very definition of an average burrito.  Not great, not terrible.
author: Brendan R.

description: I have been coming to Chino's for about 7 years.  I love this place. The food is consistantly good and very inexpensive.  I always order extra sour cream and red sauce, since I can never have enough.
author: apple b.

description: I would probably give Chino's four stars, BUT they have short changed me more than once.  The first time it happened, I thought mistakes happen. But since it happened again, I wonder if they just like to take advantage of gringos.
author: katherine l.

description: Chinos is pretty awesome... why.. because if you close your eyes you are back in Mexicali.  I love the minimalism on the inside and exterior of this place.  The food is good for the most part... Great chicken, great carne asada, yet dry pork.  The guys are nice and funny and all that.  Price is right and in the outer-richmond your only other taco choice is GORDO and that place sucks.
author: Daniel S.

description: This a good, basic, no frills neighborhood burrito place.  I find the burritos are tastier than Gordo's but not as good as El Burrito Express or the Mission.
author: JERRY D.

description:
so i used to live down the block from this place for about a year and a half. i think i've been there maybe 45 times. it's mexican food. it's fast. it doesn't make me vomit an hour after eating. that's about it. not too extravagant on the menu choices other then the standard finds (burritto, quesadilla, etc.) and it's fairly expensive for what's being offered. i understand that recent raises in costs for decent produce affects everyone, but c'mon: six bucks for a burritto that i'm going to finish in about nine mouthfuls? especially when you skimp on the cheese (seriously, there's about a scab's worth scalded to the inside of the tortilla) and gingerly flick runny, watery sour cream down the middle in the midst of a plethora of waterlogged tomatoes and lettuce shreddings? no thanks. 
but, it's not like i learned my lesson. as i said, i went there a lot. then again, it's the only mexican spot without going out of your way when you live on outerbumfuck balboa. 
i miss living out there. i don't miss chino's. 

*side note for vegetarians*

being a devout vegetarian, i never ordered anything with meat. the first time i went there with my girlfriend, who ordered chicken nachos, and asked them to put more chicken on them when she saw that they only scattered about an infant's fist worth over the top, i ordered meatless nachos. 

i then heard: "no carne? es cabron!"

which translates to: "no meat? he's a faggot!"

i thought it was funny. 

then again, i was high. 

which helps when you eat there.
author: K.K. Y.
